content: f p r a t e t e e r n sparkle 4 ply twinkle toes hand knit sock design by winwick mum follow us join our facebook community wys crafter s hub disclaimer please note that all quantities in this pattern are based on average usage and therefore are approximate we cannot accept responsibility for the finished items if any yarn other than the one specified is used although every effort has been made to ensure that instructions are correct west yorkshire spinners cannot accept any liabilities owing to photography and printing restrictions the colour reproduction is matched as closely as possible to the yarn copyright the knitwear designs in this pattern are copyrighted and must not be knitted for resale reproduction of this publication is protected by copyright and sold on the condition that it is used for non-commercial purposes no part of this book may be reproduced for resale twinkle toes twisted rib knitted socks level abbreviations cm centimetres measurements dpns double pointed needles in s inch es to fit ball of foot circumference k knit 20 22 23 24 cm 8 8 5 9 9 5 ins ktbl knit through back loop of stitch k2tog knit two stitches together yarn p purl ptbl purl through back loop of stitch west yorkshire spinners p2tog purl two stitches together signature sparkle 4ply sl1 slip 1 stitch purlwise holding yarn to the vintage tinsel 1051 1 x 100g back of your work sl2 s lip 2 stitches purlwise holding yarn to the back of your work equipment ssk slip the first stitch on the left hand needle 2 5mm needles short circular needle dpns knitwise onto the right hand needle slip the or 80cm circular for magic loop second stitch on the left hand needle purlwise onto the right hand needle slip both stitches one set dpns size 3 0mm optional for a looser cuff back onto the left hand needle and knit one set dpns size 2 5mm not required for magic loop together through back loop stitch holder optional st s stitch es stitch markers r epeat instructions inside brackets wool needle special abbreviations gauge lt left twist taking your right hand needle behind 30 stitches to 10cm 4ins in stocking stitch your work insert your right hand needle into the back worked in the round on 2 5mm needles loop of the second stitch on your left hand needle knit always use the size of needles to get the correct gauge the stitch and leave it on the needle now bring your needle forward and knit into the first stitch on the left hand needle in the usual way and slide both stitches pattern notes off the needle rt right twist keeping your needles at the front of these socks are knitted on 2 5mm needles not 3 25mm your work insert your right hand needle into the second as stated on the ball band this will produce a different stitch on the left hand needle
